Unfortunately the current group of employees seem to lack any motivation for efficiency or speed. I walked in and only one group of two ladies was in front of us. We ordered food and smoothies. It took around 25 minutes for our food, and our smoothies still weren't made. I ate my and finished my food while waiting for the smoothies. It took another 20 minutes for a grand total of 45 minutes for two smoothies. Seriously? I could have taught myself how to make our smoothies and finished them in way less time. For the nail in the coffin, the smoothies weren't even good. They tasted weak and watered down compared to what they used to be. Very disappointing.

OMG.. absolutely, positively the *BEST* thai joint in existence! Calling their food "delicious" is simply an understatement -  no review could ever do this place justice. Their service is superb, staff is very friendly, the restaurant is well kept with beautiful, authentic thai decor, and, of course, the food is AMAZING! Never fails to hit the spot.. I've had the pleasure of enjoying many different dishes at Komol, however my fav is definitely chicken panang w/ shrimp fried rice (garlic fried rice kicks butt too!!). And for desert, mango with sticky rice! Ugh.. writing this review is making me crave it. I think i'm gonna go tomorrow ;)
Great food and great prices! I tend to go here once a week for either the shawarma or falafel in a laffa.  Both great options! Would recommend to anyone looking for some great middle eastern food!

I needed to have a receipt re printed and would like to thank Brina and the other staff at customer service that made this happen!  It was much more complicated than I thought it would be and they continued to work the problem until we got a result. Many thanks.

My wife started coming to Align because Dr. Sabol works with patients with Menieres. We have been extremely happy with her treatments so far. I normally accompany her and wait in reception and have observed the most professional, supportive staff I have ever seen.  
I saw a photo on this site submitted by Bobby A about the 'drill'.  This piece of equipment has been essential to my wife's treatment.  It has helped substantially with her Menieres symptoms. Nothing to fear there!

I loved Glory Hole doughnuts even before I got to try them because, well, how can you NOT adore the name? When I finally had the chance to get them last summer on one of my trips home, I thought my love was well-deserved. They were so scrumptious, I was like a maniac trying everything I could get my hands on. So you can imagine how heartbroken I was when my sister brought home a box of them this weekend and I was greeted by doughnuts on steroids. They were almost triple the size of last year's which made the doughnut:glaze/topping WAY off. Being a fan of yeast doughnuts and anything tasty that even vaguely resembles bread, I wouldn't have minded so much except that even the bready part was a bland, soggy, uncooked-in-the-middle mess. 

Please, please bring back the Glory Hole days of yore. I remember my first bite of the Bread & Butter and I want to relive that moment!
I still have sex dreams about the burnt marshmallow ice cream from this place. MMMMMMM.
Great staff, tasty doughnuts - especially the lemon meringue pie.

I will never go back. Sat at the bar.  Bartenders were ok, but I looked at my online banking the next day & they charged me for my tab and someone else's as well.  I've never has issues with the City Tavern near my house but will think twice because of the mess now I have to go through to dispute this bill.

Technician who came to my home, Ty, was wonderful. He didn't mind that I crawled up on the roof with him so I might be able to learn a thing or two, and even though I had to wait for a part to be ordered, he made sure I knew what was happening, and even came out on a Sunday morning to get the job done. GREAT guy!!

I came here at 11:30PM (hoping to avoid long lines), and waited for 2 hours because of the rave reviews. This place IS a bar inside a hotel, with very limited seating (18-20 people?). I told my husband, "this place better be worth it."

I can only review on the dishes I tried: 
1) $10 for 6 raw oysters - I've had really good oysters before, so I would say these are pretty mediocre...grimy, creamy, and lukewarm...knowing how easily oysters can go bad, why were they not stored in colder temperature?
2) Clam chowder - it's New England style, which I don't have a problem with. It's just, again, mediocre. My husband, who grew up in east coast, was not impressed.
3) Pan Roast with extra Lobster - they do give you a large portion of lobster. I found the dish just OK. Too buttery, fatty, and much of the same taste. (You can share this dish between two people... it's huge). You can also add spiciness - 1-10. A group next to us ordered 12. Whoa.

I think I understand why people do like this place: If you are a seafood fan, the restaurant gives you large portions of crabs, lobsters, shrimps, oysters, and clams for budget-friendly price. I also realize the taste caters more to people who indulge in very rich, buttery foods. I wished I tried their jambalaya or any of the chef's specials - those do look better. I am a seafood fan, and I do not mind 1-2 hour lines if the food is worth it. For now, I am unsure if I would go here again - it's a very long wait for OK food.

*3.5 stars*

Following the Yelp reviews, I tried:
1) Garlic Prawns - pretty decent! You can also eat the crispy shells. Wish it had a bit more toasted garlic. Order a side dish to go with it, otherwise, it might feel greasy. 
2) Nam Kao Tod - WAY TOO salty, too sour.
3) Egg noodles that I forgot the name of (first dish under Northern cuisine page) Apparently, this place is popular for their northern thai cuisine. So we tried dish #1, recommended by the waiter. It was just OK - overly creamy and much of the same taste. I can't tell how authentic it is since I'm not Thai.
4) Thai iced tea - too sweet

This place has so many dishes - it's difficult to choose what to order. I really want to try their sea bass, charboiled prawns, and fried whole catfish with ginger. All with beer. My advice to you will be: get what you want, not necessarily what other Yelpers have reviewed.

I will come back again. :)

Llega con hambre y pide la hamburguesa, carne deliciosa pero grande la porciÃ³n. El filete mignon es una muy buena opciÃ³n tambiÃ©n. 

Come hungry and ask for the hamburger, great and juicy meat but quite big. Filet mignon is a great option too.

I needed some minor repairs done to my valves, and an underground leak repaired. Sprinkler Doctors got back to me quickly after I emailed them asking for an appt (24 hours or less). I booked for 3 days later. 

Wade arrived on time after calling in advance to confirm (much appreciated). He quickly went through my list of things and corrected/fixed as needed. He had easy and quick fixes for problems instead of replacing entire parts or pipes.

After the work was done, he wrote up the invoice and took credit card payment on the spot. I received a receipt via email when it was all done. I highly value vendors that can do this...take CC on site and provide digital copies of receipts.

I will definitely be using Sprinkler Doctors again for future work.

The sandwich I had (Toasty Pig) was fantastic. Pretty much an extra cheesy cuban sandwich, which was perfect for what I wanted. Sure, it's a bit pricey compared to other food truck prices at around $9.50, but to me it was worth it. I'd pay that much in a restaurant (and have) for much worse similar sandwiches. Every sandwich I saw coming out was toasted perfectly. I'll definitely go back again.

We recently moved to AZ from ND, and needed some general yard cleanup and maintenance done in our new home. Eduardo is one of the few people who responded to me via e-mail (I'm not a phone person), and was able to quickly schedule an estimate appointment. He showed up promptly, and took notes on my extensive list of items (tree trimming, remove a small palm, weed removals, palm trimming, bush trimming, removal of old landscape materials, irrigation repair). Once we were done, he sent me an estimate via email VERY shortly after. The price seemed great to me, so I scheduled for a few days later.

The crew showed up close to the window and got straight to work. It was about 3-4 hours of work, and when they left I was completely happy with what they did. The MANY weeds we had were all gone, grass mowed and edged, and all the bushes/plants looked healthy again. I was only planning to have them do the one time cleanup and have them back maybe 2-3 times a year, but I'm considering every month or two now!

Oh, and after the work was done an invoice was emailed to me. I can't tell you how much I appreciate a company embracing technology (I'm a bit of a IT nerd). I like to be able to shoot off an email late at night when I'm getting my personal to-do list done, and KO accommodates me perfectly. They called later that day and took my payment over the phone. No hassles, great service, and fast responses. One of the best 2 service companies we've had working on our home since we moved in...and it's a tie for 1st place.

Was looking for a place to take my wife for sushi (rolls) for our anniversary, and found Shimogamo highly reviewed on Yelp. I read that they often get packed during prime hours, so when I saw they take OpenTable reservations I booked it right away. 

We arrived, and were greeted by name at the door and seated right away. They weren't completely full, but still at about 75% capacity of their smaller restaurant. It was also happy hour, so we got the full menus, happy hour menus, and a nice order sheet for the sushi so we could just mark what we wanted on that. Waitress was at our table immediately to take our drink order. She was super polite, and extremely efficient.

We ordered 3 rolls and the gyoza appetizer. The Spicy Yellowtail roll showed up within minutes, followed shortly by the gyoza. Both were amazing. I'm usually not a dumpling fan, but these were lightly fried and crispy on a bed of sauce. The yellowtail roll was extremely flavorful compared to other places we've eaten. We barely finished those before our Shimogamo and Las Vegas rolls arrived. Nice presentation, and we were both amazed at how you could taste all the distinct flavors separately in the rolls. The touch of lemon in the Shimogamo roll was just perfect, and seemed to only come through at the end. 

I'm no food critic, but eating here made me want to try to describe the food like one. The happy hour prices were awesome, and they're so efficient we were in and out in 35 minutes. And no pictures because we were hungry when we started and didn't want to stop until we were done!

We're going to be regulars now I think. Fantastic.

Let me tell you a story about our last trip on Allegiant. We were booked to head back home from Minot on a Monday at 1pm. At 1:30pm we got a text saying the flight was canceled. I thought, bummer...we'll likely get booked out later that day. NOPE. Flight was rescheduled for Tuesday at 5pm. A 28 HOUR DELAY. We booked a flight on another airline out of Bismarck for early the next morning. We could have gotten home Monday night still had we known about the cancellation 30 minutes sooner.

I called the customer service number as instructed in the text to cancel our rescheduled flight. Was on hold for 10 minutes when I went to the ticket counter in Minot. Hung up after 30 minutes on hold when I got to the ticket counter. They could not do cancellations. Told me to call the number I just hung up from. We got to Bismarck that evening, and I waited another 30 minutes on hold before getting an agent. She put me on hold for another 10-15 minutes while canceling my flight, and came back to say I was canceled and would be refunded for the return trip. It may take 1-2 weeks for the refund.

That was on August 15th. When I had no refund on Sept 11th, I called and waited on hold another 20 minutes before just using their web form for customer service that stated 24-48 hours for a response. 

Today I tweeted.
And they responded within hours.
To tell me it could be another 4-6 weeks.

The savings are not worth this level of customer service. We were more than happy with their service up until the past couple of years. Cancelations and delays have increased, and customer service is so bogged down their response times are very unreasonable.
Horrible service. The food took a very long time to be ready and when it was ready it was cold. When I asked for it to be heated the waiter was very rude to me. I felt disrespected.
the best cupcakes in Madison, WI!  I go there for cupcakes; they're fresh and delicious!  However, their coffee and food are not as good as their cupcakes.
The only place that carries Intelligensia's espresso beans in Madison, WI!  It's the only cafe that people must try in Madison!

I scheduled J. Scott Refrigeration to service my central air conditioning unit and evaporative cooler on May 9, 2016 at 2:00 p.m.  The technician arrived on time.

He opened the air conditioning unit and cleaned out some debris from the return air vent.  He said the coils were dirty and needed to be cleaned but he didn't have the equipment to do it.  I offered to let him use my air compressor or brush.  He chose to use the brush but stopped cleaning after a few seconds.  

Without checking with gauges, he said the air conditioning unit needed some Freon and proceeded to connect his tank of coolant to the unit.  After a very short time, still without using gauges, he said that the unit was fully charged and, without weighing the tank before or after adding the coolant, he said that he had added three pounds of coolant.  I asked him if he was going to check for leaks and he said, "No."  Please note that air conditioning units do not "use up" Freon; if the coolant is low it is because it has leaked out.

The technician said that the condenser fan was unbalanced and might need to be replaced; I should have someone take a look at it. 

He then proceeded to "service" the evaporative cooler.  He asked me what was wrong with it and I told him one of the pumps was not working.  He said that the pump was bad even though it was brand new and that it would be cheaper for me to replace it than for him to do it.  I agreed.  He did not check the electrical system, cooler pads, blower motor, squirrel cage fan, or drive belt.  If he had checked the belt, he would have noticed that it was badly frayed and cracked;  it failed a few days later.  He did not oil the bearings or bushings on the motor or fan.  When I replaced the drive belt, one of the fan bushings was bad but he did not know this since he never checked them..  He did not turn on the water supply or check the float operation.

There were some areas on the duct work that the technician said needed to be taped but he did not have enough tape.  I supplied the tape.

Although I told the technician that I wanted him to service the air conditioning unit and evaporative cooler because I was getting too old to climb on the roof, I ended up making more trips up and down the ladder than he did  in order to get him my tools and supplies for him to use.  

When he was finished, the technician threw his tank of Freon from the roof to the lawn below. The technician then said that the Freon was very expensive and that my costs were $120.

The preceding report is factual.  Subjectively:

His methods of workmanship are unacceptable by any commonly accepted standards.  He did not have the necessary tools or supplies.  He did not do the work requested.  The neglect of using gauges or scales while recharging the air conditioning unit is both dangerous and unprofessional.  The fact that he did not check out most of the items on the evaporative cooler seems to indicate that he was more interested in showing up and collecting his fee rather than actually doing his work.

This is not a company that I would ever consider allowing back on my property.

I wish my first experience here wasn't breakfast.  I wanted to try this place after all good reviews, and I just happened to be driving by running errands and saw their breakfast sign.  It was around 9:30am on a Saturday, and I was the only person in the place.  That always makes me wonder?!

Strip mall needs a little cleanup, but the inside is very clean, comfortable, and open with both booths and tables in addition to the bar area with multiple large screens and an outdoor patio on front of building.  

I was only going to drop by quickly to grab the $4.99 2-egg, sausage, toast, potatoes and coffee special.  But after looking at the menu, I'm always a sucker for an Eggs Benedict.  The waitress was new here for a week and seemed new to waitressing in general.  No problem as we all need to learn.  However, when she asked me how I wanted my eggs for Eggs Benedict, I was surprised and worried.  I said poached and not runny.  No such luck.  The eggs were completely liquid and ran all over my plate.  The bread was thick and completely entrenched in butter, and my very thin and burnt slice of some type of meat was very inedible.  But no, not the Hollandaise miss?!  Yes, I hate to say, the Hollandaise was more of a cheesy mixture.  Sigh...

As sometimes happens when the waitress notices you completely are not enjoying your meal, she avoided me like the plague.   With now only two diners in the place, she finally came to only ask if I was ready for the bill. Hmm...I think I'll give it some time and try again but only for lunch or dinner.

Fried chicken was out of this world!  Juicy yet not overly greasy.  Shredded chicken bowl was flavorful but not too spicy, surprisingly.  Definitely good for those that can't take the heat.  The cashier was great at giving tips for my first time visit, and all employees were bilingual.  This location is clean and well lit at night.  Will be back!

Don't go here.  After being a loyal patient for 20+ years, I'm finding a dentist that truly cares.  The staff keeps changing in the past few years, so you're always getting someone different and they seem to get less experienced.  My last hygienist was nice but kept fumbling with the equipment and it wasn't making me feel comfortable.  Then, the new dentist went to fill a small pinhole cavity, and there was a lot of training going on overhead.  It wasn't till I got home, that I noticed a small piece of excess filling that was sharp inside my mouth!  I had to wait for it to fall off.  Not cool.  That filling to this day is very rough and not smooth like the rest.  Then, the cherry on top--their final bill was double the cost of their estimate, which I may understand if it was a complicated task, but it was a small pinhole of a cavity!!  How do you mess up an estimate for that?!?!  This is not how you treat paying customers, or maybe you do?! Not me.

We have purchased four cars here. Every experience with our salesman Scott McEwan has been great. Even when things haven't gone smoothly he steps up and delivers. If you're not familiar with the one person one price program they pitch here it's actually pretty great. I work in sales, so my first impression was that the one price would be a high price they just weren't willing to negotiate on. It turns out, they are the real deal. I price shopped a deal for two Toyota Tundras and no dealer would beat the price and only one offered to match it. I don't live anywhere near Avondale, I actually make the drive here from Chandler because they are the easiest to work with and have the best prices, especially if you are doing add ons or aftermarket equipment. Do your homework before you come here, and you'll see there really is no need to haggle. Then make sure you ask for Scott he really seems to know his cars.
I have taken my Tag here twice now. Both times everything has been accomplished on time and well below what I have paid at jewelry stores and watch retailers.

These guys are fantastic. Patrick and Nick were very helpful. I originally chose an SLT with tow package and the 6.2-liter engine (a difficult package to find). Henry Brown had one, however when I finally called to say I would take it, the truck had been dealer traded. The other dealership dragged its feet in returning the truck and a week went by without any commitment as to when it would be available. Nick and Patrick worked to get the truck traded back for me, in the meantime they provided me with a similar quality loaner to use while I waited. Unfortunately, the other dealership would not send back the truck and would not commit to providing a timeframe for us. With 2 weeks wasted and no new truck, I was more than disappointed. Nick was able to work out a deal on a slightly more expensive package in the same engine size and get the deal done for the same price we had already agreed on. I had the Henry Brown Custom Shop (with Joey who is really helpful) add a 4" lift, new Fuel Wheels and tires, a dual exhaust and few other items that make the truck perfect. I would recommend the team here to anyone looking for a new car. From the sales floor to the custom shop they will take care of you if you're as picky as I am you will be very satisfied.

I love this place, I have checked in 3 times but you can bet I have been here at least 30. The food is great. The drinks are always good and dont forget to use the Yelp offer for free edamame when you go.

The service here leaves a LOT to  be desired. I have been let down by the total lack of effort on the part of the sales staff a few times. Most recently I went in to purchase shoes, they did not have my size (not that big a deal). When I asked if they would have them soon, they let me know that I could come back from time to time and see (really)? I asked if I could just order the size and then they could call me when they arrived, basically the answer was no. I was told that I could order them myself online, and if they didn't fit I could return them to the store. That was ok since I also had a 20% of coupon that expired that day. They did not have them online, so I lose the coupon and still don't have an option for getting the shoes (outside of coming back periodically to check). I will not be doing that, since I will not be returning to this REI store again.

The fact is that this company has a good reputation for a reason, they have been around for a long time and do great work. We had a shower removed and replaced it with frame-less glass. The quality and work was as expected. The complaint I have is with our sales person and the resolution of issues. The installers called me promptly at 7am before our apt scheduled at 7:30-8:30 to let me know they had a flat tire (these things happen) and needed to repair it at a tire shop. 
When they arrived they found out that one of the pieces of glass loaded was incorrect (these things happen, but probably shouldn't). 
They went back to the shop to get the correct piece and now it would 11:30 before any work began. I originally figured this would be done by 12 latest, based on the 2 hour scope of work they gave me at the estimate. 
I had an apt. for my own job at 1 pm, that should have been no problem, and could not be cancelled. I called our sales rep at Roadrunner Glass to tell him I had been pushed out and had to be somewhere at 1pm. His response was that they would not be done by 1 PM(due to their issues, not mine). 
His solution was that I could cancel the apt and get back on the schedule sometime next week. Not to reschedule that afternoon, or the next day, but just whenever they could do it. I was without a shower until this was done. They seemed more than happy to push me out to whenever the next most convenient time for them was.To be honest it's just the total lack of concern for the customer and my schedule that gets them a poor review here. This review is based on customer service and their total lack of concern if something goes wrong on their end. This review is not for poor workmanship and quality. Frankly, if you buy here and nothing goes sideways, your experience will probably be fine. I did not include the estimators name, as he is the weakest link at this company by far.

This place is eggcellent (sorry had to do it)    seriously though, check this place out. Great food and good breakfast atmosphere. There are a ton of good choices, and the owner cares and is personally involved.

This is the response I got from the parish priest AFTER the baptism coordinator HUNG UP ON ME. There was more than one person present during our conversation, and I was neither rude nor belligerent. I simply asked to make the appointment and that I would fax Lilly's birth certificate over once I had time, PRIOR TO THE APPOINTMENT. They wouldn't even make the appointment and that is what upset me!
Dear Margaret,
I have spoken to the three women who interacted with you last Friday morning and on Sunday evening. To a person they describe your behavior as rude and belligerent. The packet you were mailed last October was quite explicit in stating that you are required to submit a copy of your child's birth certificate in order to have your daughter baptized. This is in accord with diocesan policy, and is in place for a variety of reasons. We do not deviate from this policy.
In that you appeared in the office on Friday morning, it is obviously not out of the question for you to also stop by your safety deposit box to retrieve the certificate. As Judy told you on the phone, we are quite flexible in arranging for baptism appointments that meet the needs of the parents, and will be happy to do so with you. Having all the requested information in hand at the time of your appointment ensures that everything is in order for your child's baptism. Our goal is to serve the needs of our parishioners as best we can, but we also rightly expect some cooperation from them as well. We will be happy to work with you and your husband to arrange for the baptism of your daughter and will set up an appointment at your convenience once you submit her birth certificate. I do not believe this is too much to ask.
I am copying this email to Fr. Diskin at the diocese.
Rev. James Turner
St. Thomas More Catholic Church
6180 West Utopia Road
Glendale, Arizona 85308-7111

Only 4 stars because not all the vets are nice... I love Dr. Bateman, she is amazing. She treats my dogs with such kindness and answers all my questions. However, Dr. Nofal (or something) is another story. I asked her some questions about my puppy and she really didn't even give me the time of day. She looked very irritated and was rushing me out. She also didn't catch my puppies ear infection, she said he was itching because of allergies and didn't even look in his ear. I had to go back to the vet a few days later because his ear was getting really bad, which Dr. Bateman diagnosed with a severe yeast infection. So -1 star because of Dr. Nofal!
Great place to let your dog off leash and run and swim! It's heavily lined with trees so you don't have to worry too much about your dog escaping somewhere or getting onto a road!
Their green tea ice cream is the best I've had in my life. And it's really hard to find good green tea ice cream!!
Spring rolls are good but the Singapore noodles are really terrible. Was expecting better.

Going through town I thought before I headed out on the road again in my RV that I should just make sure the air pressure was OK. The guys working there are not the sharpest tool in the shed. I thought they might be off a few pounds but he was adding more and so I asked what he was doing and he was trying to put 65 pounds into a 50 pound max tires. He said he must have read something on the tire that looked like it meant the pressure. I'm soooo glad I asked as in the heat in a remote place to have my tires blow out.
Then I asked this other guy how to get to a particular highway and he started asking where I was going, commenting on my RV, why I used a map if I had a GPS and literally 10 minutes later gave me a roundabout answer to how to get there without going back into the downtown area.
Run, run as fast as you can away from this place.  They might sell you something wrong or more than you need. Trust your car with someone else that actually knows about cars, especially if you are a woman. Safe to say any other place would know more about tires than Discount Tires in Mesa.

I was in my RV looking for a park to stay the night and didn't want just any where. It was over 100 outside and so I got on line and found this place listed. It had the slogan "come to play, come to stay" well it is Arizona...land of tons of retirees but I didn't put the two together. It looked awesome on the internet so I called and made reservations that I'd be there shortly. The lady was super nice on the phone and so off I went. It was about 4:30 in the afternoon and I was in no mood to keep looking for a place. I drove in and discovered it's a 55 or better place. Oops I'm not that old. The lady I spoke with on the phone was in the office and she said I could stay there anyway since it was just a night and just me. Awesome!! Well this place people stay for winters, months at a time but they have a daily rate of about $45 a night. Pool, hot tubs, club house, laundry facilities, golf course, social events and I'm sure I missed some stuff but it was great just to jump in the pool in that heat. I think I shocked some of the men there in my bikini and interupted a wine and cheese  party.
It was quiet and close off the freeway like an oasis waiting for me. I would tell anyone coming in the area to check this place out. I felt fortunate to be allowed to stay there...even for the one night.

It was a little tucked away but once I found Trader Vic's it was awesome. I had been to the one in Bellevue, WA before and liked the decor and vibe. This place was no different. Awesome with the masks, statues and whole Tahitian amosphere. A friend of mine was playing there so I went to see her band. They faced the dining room and were all in the dark. It was an odd place for the band since the bar part was packed and not so much the dining room. They didn'tj have Guinness which was a bummer but they also didn't have much of a beer selection aside from the Bud, Coors type standards. $7 for a beer was pricey I thought for Scottsdale. My friends had some yummy clam type soup and some generous portions for their entrees which they enjoyed. I had already eaten so I just drank. We tried a mixed drink that, the coke my friend had with his rum was flat and my ginger ale was flat too and tasted way too much like syrupy seven up. We sent them back but they came back tasting the same. I had asked the waiter to just bring me a shot of Captian Morgan neat but that ddn't happen. I would go back but perhaps try the happy hour for food as it was on the high side for dinner as were the drinks. The staff was nice and friendly. The drinks dept. get something that doesn't have soda with it.

Usually, I've enjoyed this location but I've had 3 consecutive trips that were horrible. When the employee making the smoothie is looking around and unsure of the ingredients then know it's over. I'm not sure if they are new hires or simply don't know how to make simple smoothies. Today, a young guy was making my smoothie and clearly was clueless and the girl behind the register knew it and didn't bother to help or make sure he was putting proper ingredients in the blender. Instead , she checked me out fast as possible and said I'm out later. Leaving me w clueless guy making my smoothie. He continued to blend and add water for another 2 minutes until he handed me a slushy w zero flavor. Avoid

After having a pretty rough day, I came out to my car that wouldn't start. I called my carrier and they advised it would be 75 minutes before the towing vendor would arrive.  Freddy, from Central Towing arrived within 10 minutes, was extremely pleasant and made me smile even after the day I had. I drive an European car and Freddy took the time to ensure it was towed properly and based on the manufacturers recommendation. If I ever need roadside assistance again, I will only call Central Towing and request Freddy.

Es un lugar de extramada hermosa naturaleza, la unica loma que tiene montreal, en verdad que es uno de los lugares mas lindos a los que he visitado, si vas a montreal tienes que hacer una parada en el park mont royal
lugar donde se aprende mucho de la vida en otros continentes, una mezcla de ingenierÃ­a y una excepcional arquitectura y un gran calor humano, super recomendable si visitas montreal no dejes de verlo

Came here for a free diagnostic test. Lady at the counter says "it'll be a couple minutes before someone can go out and help me. she didnt let anyone else know about me and why I was there so I assumed she was gonna do the test for me. 20 minutes later I see her go outside. Im pissed off by this point so I leave. Where do I find her? Outside smoking. And had nothing to say to me. She sucks. Older lady that wears an earpiece like shes busy.

would give negative stars.

towed my car here from another incompetent mechanic. took them 2 months to even touch my car. parts were missing/broken. car still not running in fact is in worse condition than it was before. BEWARE OF THIS PLACE. BUNCH OF LIARS.  this situation started at Daves Automotive. check out my review of them for the entire story.

Reasonable prices. Delicious food. Clean.

My girlfriend and I eat "Rice n Noodle" pretty often. Most of the time it's delivery. We usually get the Dinner special that includes egg rolls, rangoon, soup, rice and 2 entrÃ©es with a delivery fee of $2(i think) it all comes out to be about $26 or $27. Their generous portions take us 3 meals to finish. The math . . 
 $27 / 2 people =  $13.50 per person
$13.50 / 3meals = $4.50 per meal!!! Thats pretty decent if you ask me.
btw I'm a big boy. I can eat a good amount.

Lunch specials are awesome too. Delicious food, huge portions . $8

The service isn't too personable. They won't small talk with you while you wait for your food but they aren't rude by all means. 

Dining-in can be a little off putting at first because all their food is served in "to-go" containers. I've come to realize it's more practical as a consumer and economically as a restaurant manager. They give you so much food that your'e gonna take the rest home anyway and it saves them time and labor cost by not having to bus so much off the tables and the only things they have to wash are the pots pans and cookware the cooks use.

I love this place. If I every move away, I would consider Rice n Noodle one of the neighborhood institutions that I would miss and return to.
Le coupe aux brownies est un peu cher (7$) mais elle vaut son prix.  Peut-Ãªtre pas idÃ©al  pour manger Ã  l'intÃ©rieur mais peut importe quand la tempÃ©rature est belle
Vraiment trÃ¨s bon. En lisant le menu je ne savais pas trop Ã  quoi m'attendre mais mon choix Ã  Ã©tÃ© excellent!
Horrible coverage, horrible customer service!  I would never ever recommend anyone to Sprint!!! If your thinking about signing a contract think again. I would go to any other carrier!!!

Best groomer ever!!! I refer all my family and friends to them.  I will never take my pups to any other groomer.   The people that work there are super friendly and handle our pets with care.  Everyone I've sent to them are still going to Backroom Groom and they also refer.  I highly recommend them!!!
Do not sign contract!! Worst service and also worse customer service. Think twice, triple, quadruple times before signing that contract!! Find a different carrier!!!
Hit or miss. Nice place to catch a quick bite.

Food was okay but over priced. The waiter was lousy and only checked on us one time and that was when we were all finished. He didn't give/take our plates or ask us for refills. When the bill came around he was there immediately to collect tip and got upset because he felt we didn't give him enough money. He even said" Wow" behind me as I was walking out. He was a tall guy with blond hair and glasses. Be prepared to be disrespected when you walk into this place. Last time we will go and I'll make sure to tell my story wherever I go. 
If you are looking for authentic Mexican food head over to "Javier's Authentic Mexican Cuisine" inside the Aria. You won't get attitude from frustrated dudes who hate their job. Rather, you get great homegrown Mexican service that you can feel good about paying for.

Cade Lavengco had given my cat a misdiagnosis which prolonged his suffering that ended with his death.  I took my cat into to see Cade because he was not acting himself. He has tired, sluggish and wasn't digesting any of his food. After going with their recommendation and outsourcing my cat's blood work to California for more accuracy, I paid the extra money. After getting his test results back (which I believe were mixed up), They told me my cat was fine and that he probably ate something in my house and hinted it may be a drug of some sort. They insinuated that I might have left out drugs for my cats to eat. This was a false assumption and I was very offended but took my cat home after they gave him some "special" food and watched him sleep overnight. 

When I took my cat home he was not himself so I took him back to the hospital, this time, it was midnight because I felt it was an emergency. I got a hold of Cade whom immediately sounded stressed out and backed up his original diagnosis. I said, "NO" my cat seems like he's dying.  Cade eventually met me at the hospital and made it seem like it was a showdown for a fight, very uncomfortable.  When I got to the hospital I paid for an In-House blood test. When Cade got the results his mouth dropped to the floor. He said your cat's white blood cells are very low. He diagnosed my cat with Leukemia and asked me to pay for an X-Ray to see his lungs and confirm his NEW diagnosis. My bill was already at $2,700 at this point and I felt that my cat was in too much pain to go on.  He could barely lift his head up and move his limbs.  I gave Cade the okay to put my cat down which has still bothered me to this day.

I am holding Cade Lavengco responsible for the lack of professionalism and the misdiagnosis that prolonged my cats suffering.
The hotel is ok but their staff including management leaves a lot to be desired.   They are definitely due for some employee training on all levels.

Ray and Edgar completed a small move for me from Cleveland to my apartment in Chicago. It wasn't a lot of things, but they had to navigate their truck down some tight alleyways, and my winding back stairs are tough to handle when carrying big pieces of furniture. They were efficient and friendly the whole time. They put the bed they brought in together for me (even putting the bed skirt back in place!) and were nice enough to take apart the bed frame that had been there before too. I would recommend them to anyone!

Love Guy Fieri's show on the Food Network channel.  We had high expectations, but was sadly disappointed. The atmosphere was cool; we sat outside on the patio to listen to the music in the surrounding area/casino. Our server looked like he did not want to be there and was not pleasant. The Mac + Cheese Bacon burger was huge and pretty good. My husband's Triple B Burger was over seasoned, leaving a bad taste. All our fries with our meals were all too salty - over seasoned!  Even both our kids, who love fries, didn't like it or want any. The  Double Barrel BBQ wings were ok, nothing to brag about. Our server never checked on us during the meal, then all of a sudden, another server was asking if we wanted dessert. We kindly declined and asked for the bill. When we got it, some of the billing/charges were incorrect. If you have a "Total Rewards" players card, each of the meal prices should be discounted. This had not been the case,  only two items were discounted; the new server blamed our first server since he entered our order on the system/computer. Please review your itemize receipt before paying. They fixed the bill after we addressed it to the server, but if we didn't review it, then we would have paid more.

Rude people run the front desk and security. Two ladies act as the gestapo at the entrance to the pool - you'll be wearing a wristband the entire time. The pool itself is excellent, but the prices at the pool bar are sky high. It's only a few stories, so you can't get a good view, not that there much to see in Arizona. They charge $4 each for the bottled water in the room - even though it's regularly 110 degrees outside. Add $50+ per night to the quoted rate; you'll be paying resort fees of at least $15 each plus taxes. The rooms have balconies, but are otherwise standard upscale fare. No bathtubs in rooms, so don't expect a bath. Also don't expect: good service, low prices, or any activities other than golf and sunbathing. Expensive, overrated, staffed with rude people - obviously, I'll never go back.

Literally cannot believe the saps who think this place is classy. I guess by Scottsdale standards it might pass as nice, but I promise the staff is exceedingly rude. Avoid.

If you want a shitty room staffed by awful people, go for it. Want a mean, shitty 'manager'? Stay here. Want a dated, old school shitty room for hundreds of dollars? The Mirage is your jam. Only stay here if you want no poker, no service, and offensive staff. You'll love it!

In the scheme of Vegas, a complete waste of time. 'Service' is a masquerade. They care little to zero about you having fun. Spend your money in a better spot, and avoid this wasteland of customer service.
